summary: The Barriers to Suicide Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Transportation to establish a grant program for installing evidence-based suicide deterrents (nets, barriers, etc.) on infrastructure like bridges, buildings, and rail stations. Grants will be awarded competitively, prioritizing areas with high suicide rates. The bill also amends Title 23 of the United States Code and mandates a study by the Comptroller General to analyze the effectiveness of suicide prevention measures on various structures.
